{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498123,"name":"Berk","username":"BerkSadyam","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:51:02.290Z","cooked":"

Hi I found a sensor for using ın my robot.I couldn’T find any obligation in manuel.But ı just want to recheck.Is ıt legal to use TCS34725 Color Sensing Recognition Sensor for frc.
Here is the link for more detail of the sensor:Buy TCS34725 Color Sensing Recognition Sensor Module with cheap price

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:51:02.290Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484493,"topic_slug":"is-tcs34725-color-sensing-recognition-sensor-module-legal","display_username":"Berk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.robotistan.com/tcs34725-color-sensing-recognition-sensor-module","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Buy TCS34725 Color Sensing Recognition Sensor Module with cheap price","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71572,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-tcs34725-color-sensing-recognition-sensor-module-legal/484493/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3498133,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:57:22.866Z","cooked":"

That would fall under the generic rule for custom circuits. There is no more direct rules dealing with them, but do look in the rule book for rules about custom circuits (can’t directly control actuators, need power source not on motor paths, no high voltage, etc).

That sensor should be fine given you follow those rules.

Yes - I ageee with Steve, see R614. Get it now and start testing to see if it’ll do what you want.

I make my comments as a robot inspector would (I have in the past).

Personally, I would recommend getting a prepackaged color sensor like the Rev one (Color Sensor V3 - REV Robotics). It’s a prepackaged solution, and you don’t have to write your own driver to talk to it. (Writing I2C drivers for the Roborio isn’t the easiest). There might even be a video of me out there talking about the Rev sensor online. (2020 RI3D)

But, not knowing your use case, and I think you are in Turkey (based on that sensor website), it might be easier to use that sensor.
